1.A.title: Key Elements Enhance Meaning and Style - Day 1
objectives: Identify key literary elements (setting, plot, characterization, conflict, point of view, theme, tone)
Define how each element contributes to a literary text
Recognize basic connections between elements

2.A.title: Key Elements Enhance Meaning and Style - Day 2
objectives: Demonstrate understanding of how elements work together
Apply knowledge of literary elements to analyze specific texts
Explain how specific elements enhance meaning or add layers
Practice identifying element interactions in various texts

3.A.title: Narrator Perspective, Irony, and Satire - Day 1
objectives: Identify different narrator perspectives (first person, third person limited, third person omniscient)
Define the characteristics of each narrative perspective
Recognize how perspective shapes reader understanding

4.A.title: Narrator Perspective, Irony, and Satire - Day 2
objectives: Analyze how narrator perspective influences text interpretation
Examine the impact of perspective on character development
Explain how authors create irony through narrative choices
Identify examples of satire and their purposes

5.A.title: Compare Opposing Arguments - Day 1
objectives: Identify claims in opposing arguments on the same topic
Recognize the structure of argumentative texts
Define what makes an argument effective

6.A.title: Compare Opposing Arguments - Day 2
objectives: Compare the development strategies of two opposing arguments
Analyze the evidence used to support each claim
Evaluate the effectiveness and validity of opposing claims
Assess the credibility of sources in each argument
Identify source material from mythical, classical, or religious texts
Compare original texts with modern adaptations
Analyze how authors transform themes across adaptations
Evaluate the purpose and effectiveness of adaptations
Identify rhetorical devices (irony, rhetorical question, antithesis, zeugma, metonymy, synecdoche)
Explain the purpose of specific rhetorical devices in texts
Analyze how rhetoric enhances author's message
Evaluate the effectiveness of rhetorical choices

9.A.title: Context Clues and Word Meanings - Day 1
objectives: Identify various types of context clues in texts
Apply context clues to determine unfamiliar word meanings
Recognize when context provides sufficient information

10.A.title: Context Clues and Word Meanings - Day 2
objectives: Demonstrate proficiency using context to decode complex vocabulary
Practice context clue strategies across different text types
Explain reasoning when determining word meanings from context

11.A.title: Context Clues and Word Meanings - Day 3
objectives: Analyze effectiveness of different context clue types
Compare word meanings across multiple contexts
Categorize context clues by type and usefulness

12.A.title: Context Clues and Word Meanings - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate which context clues provide most reliable meaning
Assess when additional resources are needed beyond context
Justify word meaning interpretations using textual evidence
Critique insufficient or misleading context clues

13.A.title: Paraphrase Grade-Level Texts - Day 1
objectives: Identify key ideas in grade-level texts
Define the difference between paraphrasing and summarizing
Recognize essential versus supporting information

14.A.title: Paraphrase Grade-Level Texts - Day 2
objectives: Restate information in own words while maintaining meaning
Apply paraphrasing techniques to simple passages
Practice maintaining author's intent while changing language

15.A.title: Paraphrase Grade-Level Texts - Day 3
objectives: Analyze paraphrased texts for accuracy and completeness
Distinguish between effective and ineffective paraphrasing
Compare original texts with various paraphrase attempts

16.A.title: Paraphrase Grade-Level Texts - Day 4
objectives: Apply paraphrasing skills across different text types and complexities
Evaluate paraphrases for accuracy, completeness, and clarity
Create effective paraphrases of complex grade-level texts
Assess when direct quotation is preferable to paraphrasing

17.A.title: Figurative Language Creates Mood - Day 1
objectives: Identify figurative language devices (metaphor, simile, alliteration, onomatopoeia)
Recognize personification, hyperbole, meiosis, allusion, and idiom in texts
Define each type of figurative language

18.A.title: Figurative Language Creates Mood - Day 2
objectives: Explain how specific figurative language affects meaning
Demonstrate understanding of how figurative language creates mood
Apply knowledge of devices to interpret author's mood choices

19.A.title: Figurative Language Creates Mood - Day 3
objectives: Analyze the relationship between figurative language and mood
Examine how different devices create different emotional effects
Compare mood shifts created by various figurative language choices

20.A.title: Figurative Language Creates Mood - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate the effectiveness of specific figurative language choices
Assess how well authors use figurative language to achieve mood
Justify interpretations of mood based on figurative language analysis

21.A.title: Figurative Language Creates Mood - Day 5
objectives: Create original examples of figurative language to achieve specific moods
Design passages that use multiple devices to enhance mood
Compose analytical paragraphs explaining figurative language effects
Synthesize understanding by crafting mood-appropriate figurative language

22.A.title: Narrative Writing Techniques - Day 1
objectives: Identify narrative techniques (dialogue, pacing, description, reflection)
Recognize how these techniques function in model texts
Define the purpose of each narrative technique

23.A.title: Narrative Writing Techniques - Day 2
objectives: Apply narrative techniques in short writing exercises
Use varied transitions to sequence events effectively
Demonstrate understanding of point of view consistency

24.A.title: Narrative Writing Techniques - Day 3
objectives: Establish and maintain a clear point of view across longer narratives
Develop characters, setting, and plot coherently
Analyze which techniques best serve specific narrative purposes

25.A.title: Narrative Writing Techniques - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate the effectiveness of narrative technique choices in own writing
Revise narratives to strengthen technique application
Assess peer narratives for technique use and effectiveness
Refine narrative coherence through targeted technique improvement

26.A.title: Revision Using Multiple Sources - Day 1
objectives: Identify types of feedback from multiple sources (adults, peers, online tools)
Recognize constructive versus non-constructive feedback
Understand how to interpret feedback for revision

27.A.title: Revision Using Multiple Sources - Day 2
objectives: Analyze feedback from multiple sources to prioritize revisions
Apply feedback to improve writing organization and clarity
Demonstrate ability to incorporate suggestions while maintaining voice

28.A.title: Revision Using Multiple Sources - Day 3
objectives: Evaluate which feedback sources provide most valuable insights
Compare feedback from different sources for consistency
Synthesize multiple feedback sources into revision plan

29.A.title: Revision Using Multiple Sources - Day 4
objectives: Revise writing based on comprehensive feedback analysis
Assess improvement from initial draft to revised version
Create responses explaining which feedback was incorporated and why
Justify revision choices based on multiple feedback sources

30.A.title: Parallel Structure for Variety - Day 1
objectives: Identify parallel structure in model sentences and paragraphs
Recognize when parallel structure enhances readability
Define the rules for creating parallel construction

31.A.title: Parallel Structure for Variety - Day 2
objectives: Apply parallel structure to add variety to writing
Practice creating balanced sentences with parallel elements
Demonstrate understanding of parallelism in lists and comparisons

32.A.title: Parallel Structure for Variety - Day 3
objectives: Analyze the effect of parallel structure on tone and emphasis
Examine how parallelism creates rhythm in writing
Compare writing with and without effective parallel structure

33.A.title: Parallel Structure for Variety - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate own writing for opportunities to use parallel structure
Revise sentences to incorporate effective parallelism
Assess how parallel structure improves clarity and flow

34.A.title: Parallel Structure for Variety - Day 5
objectives: Create original writing showcasing sophisticated parallel structure
Design complex sentences with multiple parallel elements
Compose paragraphs that use parallelism for emphasis and variety
Synthesize understanding by crafting polished, varied writing with parallelism

35.A.title: Word Origins and Meanings - Day 1
objectives: Identify common Greek and Latin roots in English words
Recognize patterns in word formation from origins
Define how etymology reveals meaning

36.A.title: Word Origins and Meanings - Day 2
objectives: Analyze word origins to determine precise meanings
Apply knowledge of roots, prefixes, and suffixes to decode unfamiliar words
Demonstrate understanding of how origins relate to modern usage

37.A.title: Word Origins and Meanings - Day 3
objectives: Compare words with similar origins to understand meaning nuances
Examine how word origins influence connotation
Categorize words by etymological families

38.A.title: Word Origins and Meanings - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate how understanding origins improves vocabulary acquisition
Assess the reliability of etymological clues for meaning
Create word webs connecting related etymological terms
Apply etymology knowledge to expand academic vocabulary

39.A.title: Central Idea Development - Day 1
objectives: Identify central ideas in informational texts
Recognize topic sentences and thesis statements
Define the difference between main idea and supporting details

40.A.title: Central Idea Development - Day 2
objectives: Explain how authors develop central ideas through paragraph structure
Trace the development of central ideas across text sections
Apply understanding to summarize central ideas accurately

41.A.title: Central Idea Development - Day 3
objectives: Analyze the support an author uses to develop central ideas
Examine the effectiveness of evidence in supporting main ideas
Compare how different texts develop similar central ideas

42.A.title: Central Idea Development - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate the support an author uses to develop central ideas throughout a text
Assess the adequacy and relevance of supporting evidence
Critique weak central idea development in informational texts
Justify interpretations of central ideas using textual support

43.A.title: Rhetorical Appeals and Figurative Language - Day 1
objectives: Identify rhetorical appeals (logos, ethos, pathos) in texts
Recognize when authors use figurative language for persuasion
Define how appeals and figurative language work together

44.A.title: Rhetorical Appeals and Figurative Language - Day 2
objectives: Explain how specific rhetorical appeals support author's purpose
Demonstrate understanding of appeal effectiveness
Apply knowledge to identify multiple appeals in complex texts

45.A.title: Rhetorical Appeals and Figurative Language - Day 3
objectives: Analyze how an author establishes purpose through rhetorical appeals
Examine the relationship between figurative language and persuasion
Compare effectiveness of different appeal types in various texts

46.A.title: Rhetorical Appeals and Figurative Language - Day 4
objectives: Analyze how an author achieves purpose through combined rhetorical strategies
Evaluate the effectiveness of rhetorical appeals and figurative language
Assess whether author successfully persuades intended audience
Synthesize understanding of how rhetoric and figurative language interact

47.A.title: Text Structures and Features - Day 1
objectives: Identify text structures (description, problem/solution, chronological, compare/contrast, cause/effect, sequence)
Recognize organizational features in informational texts
Define how structure supports content

48.A.title: Text Structures and Features - Day 2
objectives: Explain how specific structures convey meaning
Apply understanding of structure to predict content organization
Demonstrate ability to follow complex structural patterns

49.A.title: Text Structures and Features - Day 3
objectives: Analyze how multiple text structures work together
Examine how text features enhance comprehension
Compare how different structures present similar information

50.A.title: Text Structures and Features - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate how effectively structure supports author's purpose
Assess when specific structures are most appropriate
Critique structural choices in informational texts

51.A.title: Text Structures and Features - Day 5
objectives: Analyze how multiple text structures and/or features convey purpose and meaning
Create organizational plans using appropriate structures for specific purposes
Design texts that combine multiple structures effectively
Synthesize understanding by crafting well-structured informational writing

52.A.title: Argumentative Writing with Claims - Day 1
objectives: Identify strong claims in argumentative texts
Recognize logical reasoning patterns
Define what makes a claim arguable and specific

53.A.title: Argumentative Writing with Claims - Day 2
objectives: Develop claims supported by logical reasoning
Apply logical reasoning to support claims with evidence
Demonstrate ability to distinguish claims from opinions

54.A.title: Argumentative Writing with Claims - Day 3
objectives: Analyze the logical progression from claim to evidence to reasoning
Examine counterarguments and refutations
Evaluate the strength of logical connections in arguments

55.A.title: Argumentative Writing with Claims - Day 4
objectives: Create sophisticated claims with comprehensive logical support
Construct complete arguments with claims, evidence, reasoning, and refutation
Assess and revise arguments for logical consistency and strength
Synthesize multiple sources to develop well-reasoned claims

56.A.title: Oral Presentations - Day 1
objectives: Identify elements of effective oral presentations
Recognize organizational strategies for presentations
Understand how to structure information logically

57.A.title: Oral Presentations - Day 2
objectives: Organize information logically for presentations
Apply presentation techniques to engage audience
Demonstrate understanding of pacing and clarity

58.A.title: Oral Presentations - Day 3
objectives: Develop presentations with clear introduction, body, and conclusion
Analyze audience needs and adapt presentation accordingly
Practice effective delivery techniques (eye contact, gestures, voice)

59.A.title: Oral Presentations - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate own presentations for clarity and organization
Assess peer presentations using established criteria
Revise presentations based on practice and feedback

60.A.title: Oral Presentations - Day 5
objectives: Create polished presentations with logical organization
Deliver presentations with confidence and audience engagement
Synthesize content knowledge with presentation skills
Design visual aids that enhance presentation effectiveness

61.A.title: Epic Poetry Analysis - Day 1
objectives: Identify characteristics of epic poetry
Recognize epic conventions (heroes, quests, divine intervention)
Define elements specific to epic genre

62.A.title: Epic Poetry Analysis - Day 2
objectives: Explain how epic poetry differs from other poetic forms
Analyze characters in epic poetry
Examine epic structures and themes

63.A.title: Epic Poetry Analysis - Day 3
objectives: Analyze the characters, structures, and themes of epic poetry
Compare epic heroes across different works
Evaluate how epics reflect cultural values

64.A.title: Epic Poetry Analysis - Day 4
objectives: Synthesize understanding of epic poetry conventions
Assess the relevance of epic themes to modern contexts
Create analysis connecting epic poetry to contemporary literature
Evaluate how epics have influenced later literary works

65.A.title: Research and Focused Questions - Day 1
objectives: Identify characteristics of effective research questions
Recognize the difference between broad and focused questions
Define what makes a question researchable

66.A.title: Research and Focused Questions - Day 2
objectives: Develop focused research questions on given topics
Apply questioning strategies to narrow broad topics
Demonstrate ability to refine questions based on available sources

67.A.title: Research and Focused Questions - Day 3
objectives: Analyze research questions for clarity and scope
Evaluate whether questions are appropriately focused
Revise research questions to improve focus and achievability

68.A.title: Research and Focused Questions - Day 4
objectives: Create sophisticated research questions that guide inquiry
Develop multiple related questions to explore topic thoroughly
Assess question quality before beginning research
Synthesize preliminary research to refine questions further

69.A.title: Expository Writing - Explaining Complex Information - Day 1
objectives: Identify strategies for explaining complex information clearly
Recognize organizational patterns in expository writing
Define techniques for breaking down complex concepts

70.A.title: Expository Writing - Explaining Complex Information - Day 2
objectives: Explain complex information clearly using appropriate strategies
Apply organizational patterns to structure explanations
Demonstrate ability to define unfamiliar terms for readers

71.A.title: Expository Writing - Explaining Complex Information - Day 3
objectives: Develop comprehensive expository texts with clear explanations
Analyze the effectiveness of explanatory techniques
Evaluate whether complex information is accessible to intended audience

72.A.title: Expository Writing - Explaining Complex Information - Day 4
objectives: Create polished expository writing that makes complex ideas clear
Revise explanations based on reader feedback
Assess clarity and completeness of complex explanations
Synthesize multiple sources to explain multifaceted concepts

73.A.title: Digital Presentations - Day 1
objectives: Identify elements of effective digital presentations
Recognize appropriate digital tools for different purposes
Define principles of visual design for presentations

74.A.title: Digital Presentations - Day 2
objectives: Create digital presentations with coherent ideas
Apply design principles to enhance message
Demonstrate proficiency with presentation software

75.A.title: Digital Presentations - Day 3
objectives: Develop multimedia presentations with integrated text, images, and media
Analyze effectiveness of digital presentation choices
Evaluate balance between visual and verbal content

76.A.title: Digital Presentations - Day 4
objectives: Design sophisticated digital presentations for specific audiences
Create presentations with seamless integration of multimedia elements
Assess and refine digital presentations for maximum impact
Synthesize content with technology to create engaging presentations

77.A.title: Universal Themes in Literature - Day 1
objectives: Identify universal themes in literature
Recognize common themes across different texts
Define what makes a theme universal

78.A.title: Universal Themes in Literature - Day 2
objectives: Explain how themes develop throughout a literary text
Trace theme development from beginning to end
Apply understanding to identify theme progression

79.A.title: Universal Themes in Literature - Day 3
objectives: Analyze universal themes and their development throughout literary texts
Examine how authors reveal themes through characters and events
Compare how different texts explore similar universal themes

80.A.title: Universal Themes in Literature - Day 4
objectives: Evaluate the effectiveness of theme development in literature
Synthesize understanding by connecting themes across multiple works
Assess how universal themes remain relevant across time and culture
Create analytical essays exploring complex theme development

81.A.title: Online Collaboration - Day 1
objectives: Identify features of online collaborative platforms
Recognize effective collaboration practices
Define digital citizenship in collaborative spaces

82.A.title: Online Collaboration - Day 2
objectives: Use online collaborative platforms effectively
Apply collaboration protocols for group work
Demonstrate ability to contribute meaningfully online

83.A.title: Online Collaboration - Day 3
objectives: Analyze effectiveness of online collaboration tools
Evaluate quality of collaborative contributions
Compare different platforms for various collaborative purposes

84.A.title: Online Collaboration - Day 4
objectives: Create collaborative projects using online platforms
Assess collaboration process and refine participation
Design workflows that maximize online collaboration benefits

85.A.title: Online Collaboration - Day 5
objectives: Synthesize individual and group contributions into polished products
Lead online collaborative efforts effectively
Evaluate and improve online collaboration strategies
Create sophisticated collaborative projects using multiple digital tools
